title: PlayStation 4 Suddenly Loud? Simple Tips to Prevent Noise

steps.title: A loud PS4 can indicate accumulated dust and overheating.
steps.content: A loud PS4 can indicate accumulated dust and overheating. If you've had your PlayStation 4 console for a while, you may notice that it starts to struggle when playing more demanding games, like GTA V , Assassin's Creed, and other AAA games. This can be due to excess dust in your console's vents and fan and poor ventilation. [1] X Research source To keep your PS4 from sounding like a jet engine, make sure to perform regular cleaning and keep your console in an area with good airflow.

steps.title: Place your PlayStation 4 in a well-ventilated area.
steps.content: Place your PlayStation 4 in a well-ventilated area. If you have your PS4 on a TV stand surrounded by books and other knickknacks, this can block airflow needed for the fan. Try moving it in a position with about six (6) inches of clearance on all sides. Don't place your console inside a closed cabinet or drawer; this can trap the hot air and let it continuously cycle through.

steps.title: Use compressed air.
steps.content: Use compressed air. Make sure to turn off your PS4 and unplug it from all power sources before cleaning it. Spray towards the vents to clean the dust off quickly. This can get a decent clean without completely opening the console.

steps.title: Deep clean your PS4.
steps.content: Deep clean your PS4. If you consider yourself a handy person, you can open the PS4 to clean the interior and, if needed, replace the thermal paste . If you don't feel comfortable doing this, you can always take your console to a repair shop or certified technician.
